explanation:
OS_DeleteAllObjects — Direct callee of OS_API_Teardown; must be inspected for any use of memcpy/strcpy/etc. while deleting/renaming objects or copying names/buffers.

OS_ForEachObject — Called by OS_DeleteAllObjects to iterate objects; the iterator or callbacks may copy object names or metadata (potential string/buffer operations).

OS_ForEachObjectOfType — Same rationale as OS_ForEachObject (type-filtered iteration used during deletion) — implementations or callbacks may perform string operations.

OS_ApplicationShutdown — Direct callee of OS_API_Teardown; its wrapper may itself perform string handling or forward arguments to implementations that do.

OS_ApplicationShutdown_Impl — The implementation invoked by OS_ApplicationShutdown; must be inspected for any string.h usage when shutting down internal objects or logging.

UT_ExecuteBasicHandler — Appears in the static call graph for the teardown path/stubs; test stub dispatchers often copy/format data or manipulate buffers — inspect for string functions.

UT_GetStubEntry — Helper used by UT_ExecuteBasicHandler; may return data structures containing strings or perform copies.

UT_SetHandlerFunction — Stub registration helper; could perform pointer/size checks or string copies when setting handlers or context metadata.

UT_DefaultStubImpl — Default stub implementation invoked by UT_ExecuteBasicHandler; often performs default returns or copies and may use string functions.

UT_Stub_RegisterContextWithMetaData — Called from OS_ApplicationShutdown per call graph; may copy context strings/metadata into buffers and needs review for out-of-bounds accesses.

OS_GetResourceName — Utility used throughout OS object operations to obtain or copy resource names into caller buffers; critical to check for correct buffer-size usage.

OS_IdentifyObject — Functions that translate object ids to names/types often format or copy strings; included because DeleteAllObjects/ForEach may use it during cleanup.

Notes: The two direct callees (OS_DeleteAllObjects and OS_ApplicationShutdown) and their immediate implementations/iterator helpers are mandatory to analyze. The UT_* stub helpers are included because the static graph shows stub dispatch being involved in the teardown path and stubs commonly perform string/buffer operations. The OS_GetResourceName and OS_IdentifyObject utilities are included because object deletion/iteration commonly uses them to create/log or move object names; any use of string.h there could produce MISRA violations that propagate to the teardown path.
